channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Electronic Arts to go private in record $55 billion buyout, the largest in private equity history
item.description: Electronic Arts' stock climbed after they confirmed the private-equity buyout rumors.

item.title: Dealmakers defy stubborn M&A market with rare $1 trillion haul
item.description: Global deal values have topped $1 trillion in a third quarter for only the second time on record, according to data compiled by Bloomberg.

item.title: $55 Billion Deal for Electronic Arts Is Biggest Buyout Ever
item.description: Jared Kushner’s private equity firm and Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund are some of the investors teaming up to take the video game giant private...

item.title: Millions of workers are left out of the ‘low-hire, low-fire’ U.S. job market
item.description: "I don’t wanna use the word begging — but I’m like working a lot. Harder than I thought I would have to secure a position on a senior level.”

item.title: Meet Lisa Monaco, the 57-year-old Microsoft executive Trump wants fired
item.description: The former deputy attorney general played a key role in several high-profile investigations that directly involved Trump.

item.title: U.S. gold reserves hit $1 trillion in value after record rally
item.description: The Treasury’s gold reserves have surpassed $1 trillion in value, more than 90 times what’s stated on the government’s balance sheet.

item.title: After Charlie Kirk’s Death, a Bumper Crop of Conspiracy Theories
item.description: Much of the speculation around the death of the right-wing activist is being promulgated by conspiracy-minded personalities he helped elevate.

item.title: How Adams Lost His Coalition and Became an Also-Ran
item.description: Eric Adams started with strong support among Black and working-class voters. By the time he dropped out, his re-election effort was polling below 10 p...

item.title: Trump’s Tactics on Crime
item.description: We explore the president’s new tough-on-crime tactics and how they’re working.

item.title: Denmark Bans Civilian Drone Flights Ahead of Major E.U. Summit
item.description: A spate of recent drone sightings near airports in Denmark and Norway has amplified security concerns in Europe.

item.title: The Man Expanding Trump’s Presidential Powers
item.description: Coral Davenport, a New York Times reporter, explains how Russell Vought, the director of the Office of Management and Budget, plans to circumvent Cong...

item.title: Fear and Hope in Venezuela as U.S. Warships Lurk
item.description: On a visit to Venezuela, The Times found a nation bracing for potential U.S. military action.

item.title: Russian Meddling Fails to Swing a Pivotal Election in Europe
item.description: Moldova’s pro-European party was set for a majority in Parliament, in a vote widely seen as a showdown between Europe and Russia.

item.title: What Is the Palestinian Authority?
item.description: The body, led by Mahmoud Abbas, administers parts of the Israeli-occupied West Bank and considers itself the rightful government of a future Palestini...

item.title: Here’s the latest.
